title: Membership Handbook
fallbackContent:
The Delaware DSA Membership Handbook serves as your comprehensive guide to getting involved with our chapter. Whether you're a new member or a longtime participant, this handbook provides essential information about our structure, activities, and how to make the most of your membership.

Our handbook covers everything from chapter governance and meeting procedures to committee involvement and organizing campaigns. It reflects our commitment to transparency, member engagement, and building a strong democratic socialist movement in Delaware.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: How do I get involved as a new member?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: Start by attending our monthly General Meetings and joining our new member orientation. Consider joining a committee or working group that aligns with your interests and availability. Don't hesitate to reach out to our Membership Coordinator with questions.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: What committees and working groups can I join?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: We have five standing committees (Political Education, Communications, Membership Engagement, Red Rabbits, and Socialists-in-Office) plus several working groups including Housing Justice, Migrant Rights, Queer Socialists, and Mutual Aid. All are open to members in good standing.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: How often are meetings and events held?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: General Meetings are held monthly, typically on the second Sunday. Committee meetings vary but usually occur monthly or bi-weekly. We also host regular educational events, social gatherings, and campaign actions throughout the year.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: What is expected of members?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: We ask members to stay current on dues, participate in chapter democracy through meetings and votes, and contribute to our collective work through committee participation, volunteering, or campaign involvement according to their capacity.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: How can I propose new initiatives or campaigns?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: Any member can bring proposals to the Steering Committee or General Meetings. For major initiatives, gather input from relevant committees and ensure your proposal aligns with our democratic socialist values and strategic priorities.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.question: What support is available for new organizers?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.answer: We provide mentorship through our buddy system, regular political education opportunities, organizing training workshops, and access to national DSA resources. Our Political Education Committee offers ongoing support for developing organizing skills.
